permissions.websocket.connect: Allows a user to connect to the websocket instance for a server to stream the console.
permissions.control.console: Allows a user to send commands to the server instance via the console.
permissions.control.start: Allows a user to start the server if it is stopped.
permissions.control.stop: Allows a user to stop a server if it is running.
permissions.control.restart: Allows a user to perform a server restart. This allows them to start the server if it is offline, but not put the server in a completely stopped state.
permissions.user.create: Allows a user to create new subusers for the server.
permissions.user.read: Allows the user to view subusers and their permissions for the server.
permissions.user.update: Allows a user to modify other subusers.
permissions.user.delete: Allows a user to delete a subuser from the server.
permissions.file.create: Allows a user to create additional files and folders via the Panel or direct upload.
permissions.file.read: Allows a user to view the contents of a directory, but not view the contents of or download files.
permissions.file.read-content: Allows a user to view the contents of a given file. This will also allow the user to download files.
permissions.file.update: Allows a user to update the contents of an existing file or directory.
permissions.file.delete: Allows a user to delete files or directories.
permissions.file.archive: Allows a user to archive the contents of a directory as well as decompress existing archives on the system.
permissions.file.sftp: Allows a user to connect to SFTP and manage server files using the other assigned file permissions.
permissions.backup.create: Allows a user to create new backups for this server.
permissions.backup.read: Allows a user to view all backups that exist for this server.
permissions.backup.delete: Allows a user to remove backups from the system.
permissions.backup.download: Allows a user to download a backup for the server. Danger: this allows a user to access all files for the server in the backup.
permissions.backup.restore: Allows a user to restore a backup for the server. Danger: this allows the user to delete all of the server files in the process.
permissions.allocation.read: Allows a user to view all allocations currently assigned to this server. Users with any level of access to this server can always view the primary allocation.
permissions.allocation.create: Allows a user to assign additional allocations to the server.
permissions.allocation.update: Allows a user to change the primary server allocation and attach notes to each allocation.
permissions.allocation.delete: Allows a user to delete an allocation from the server.
permissions.startup.read: Allows a user to view the startup variables for a server.
permissions.startup.update: Allows a user to modify the startup variables for the server.
permissions.startup.docker-image: Allows a user to modify the Docker image used when running the server.
permissions.database.create: Allows a user to create a new database for this server.
permissions.database.read: Allows a user to view the database associated with this server.
permissions.database.update: Allows a user to rotate the password on a database instance. If the user does not have the view_password permission they will not see the updated password.
permissions.database.delete: Allows a user to remove a database instance from this server.
permissions.database.view_password: Allows a user to view the password associated with a database instance for this server.
permissions.schedule.create: Allows a user to create new schedules for this server.
permissions.schedule.read: Allows a user to view schedules and the tasks associated with them for this server.
permissions.schedule.update: Allows a user to update schedules and schedule tasks for this server.
permissions.schedule.delete: Allows a user to delete schedules for this server.
permissions.settings.rename: Allows a user to rename this server.
permissions.settings.reinstall: Allows a user to trigger a reinstall of this server.
permissions.activity.read: Allows a user to view the activity logs for the server.

errors.internal: An error occured from the server host side!
errors.no_servers: Currently, there are no servers associated with your account.
errors.other_state: An error occured while trying to get server data. Please check if the server has been suspended, is currently installing or getting transfered to a new node.
errors.rate_limit: Your API key has been rate-limited. Please try again later.
errors.invalid_email: You have entered an invalid Email Address.
errors.email_exists: An account already exists with this Email Address!
errors.permission: You don't have enough permission to access this resource.
errors.password_match: The confirmation password doesn't match with the password you entered.
errors.invalid_password: You have entered an invalid password. Please try another password.
errors.backup_not_found: Currently, there are no backups on this server.
errors.schedule_not_found: Currently, there are no schedules configured for this server.
errors.database_not_found: Currently, there are no databases on this server.
errors.subuser_not_found: Currently, there are no subusers on this Server.
errors.offline_server: You cannot send a console command to an offline server! Power on the server to send console commands.
errors.directory_empty: This directory seems to be empty...
errors.no_tasks: Currently, there are no tasks associated with this schedule.
errors.invalid_api: Got a invalid API key! Rerun the command:
errors.key_missing: Link your Pterodactyl Panel Account with the Bot.
errors.other_user_server: You cannot control other people's server!
errors.admin_invalid_api: Got an invalid API key in the config! Please change it in
errors.no_instance: Currently, there are no Active Console Instances associated with your account.
errors.instance_missing: This Console Instance is missing in the Persistent List

api.title: Steps to Create an API key:
api.value: Go to your Account Settings in the panel and click on API Credentials.
api.value2: Then, create an API Key and copy the key. Once that is done, rerun the command:

main.name: Name
main.api key is of 48 characters length: The API key is usually 48 characters long.
main.successfully linked your pterodactyl acc: Successfully linked your Pterodactyl Account with
main.successfully changed your pterodactyl ac: Successfully changed your Pterodactyl Account Email!
Successfully changed your Pterodactyl Account Password!
main.currently bot is in maintenance: Whoops! Currently, the bot is in maintenance. Please try again later.
main.loading the persistent server controlabl: Loading the Persistent Server Controlable Embed...
main.you are not allowed to use this command: You are not allowed to use this command!
main.there's no users registered with the pan: There are no users registered on the panel.
main.there's no user with this input: There's no user with this input.
main.an error occured while reloading the con: An error occured while reloading the config file!
main.Please assign administrator permissions: Please assign administrator permissions to the bot

help.server: Consists of all commands related to Server
help.account: Consists of all commands related to Account
help.admin: Consists of all commands which can be only used by an admin
help.option.server: Select a server from this list.
help.option.user: Select a user to get details about that user.
help.option.send_in: Select the way to send the reponse from the bot.
help.option.signal: Select the way to send the Server Controlable Embed.
help.list: Get a list of servers associated with your account.
help.control: Get an embed with controllable buttons and server usage graphs.
help.power: Send a power signal to the server.
help.command: Send a console command to the server.
help.file-manager: Get a miniature of the real Pterodactyl file manager.
help.schedules: Get a list of schedules associated with the server.
help.backups: Get a list of backups associated with the server.
help.databases: Get the list of databases associated with the server.
help.subusers: Get the list of users associated with the server.
help.sftp: Get the SFTP details associated with the server.
help.link: Link your Pterodactyl Panel Account with the bot.
help.details: Get the Account Details of the Linked API key.
help.active_console: Get list of all Active Console with your account.
help.server_details: Get details about a specific server.
help.user_details: Get details about a specific user.
help.option.show_buttons: Show / Hide Controllable Buttons in the embed.
